body.p: Patients often get a fever after an operation. Which of the following would not be a reasonable cause of such a response?

multiple_choice.choice: Tissue trauma from the operation has stimulated body cells to release pyrogens.
Despite precautions, some bacteria have infected the person during the operation.
The operation has damaged the thermoreceptors.
Post-operative medications have impacted the immune system, causing the release of pyrogens.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This could be a cause of post-operative fever.
Incorrect. This could be a cause of post-operative fever.
Correct. Thermoreceptors are located throughout the body, so it is unlikely an operation would directly damage all the receptors.
Incorrect. This could be a cause of post-operative fever.

part.hint: Think about the things that could cause an increase in pyrogens to stimulate the chemoreceptors and initiate a febrile response.
